item.title: Right to Counsel FAQs
item.description: What is the right to counsel? The right to counsel is a legal guarantee that a tenant will be granted representation by an attorney before they are evicted from their home. How effective is the right to counsel at preventing evictions? Studies of the jurisdictions that have passed right to counsel laws all reveal benefits to tenants. When represented through RTC programs, tenants are much more likely to stay in their homes â€” as much as 41% â€” because lawyers can help tenants identify available defenses and resources like rental assistance programs.
